block.p: Graph shows a running tally ranking the most joked-about politicians in late-night network TV monologues: Friday night, Sept. 29, through Thursday night, Oct. 5.
Graph shows a running tally ranking the most joked-about politicians in late-night network TV monologues: Friday night, Sept. 29, through Thursday night, Oct. 5.
George W. Bush: 30 % CHANGE FROM SEPT. 17 -- up 25% NUMBER OF JOKES FROM SEPT. 17 -- 24
Al Gore: 21 % CHANGE FROM SEPT. 17 -- down 9% NUMBER OF JOKES FROM SEPT. 17 -- 23
Dick Cheney: 6 % CHANGE FROM SEPT. 17 -- up 100% NUMBER OF JOKES FROM SEPT. 17 -- 3
Joe Lieberman: 5 % CHANGE FROM SEPT. 17 -- up 150% NUMBER OF JOKES FROM SEPT. 17 -- 2
Hillary Clinton: 4 % CHANGE FROM SEPT. 17 -- down 50% NUMBER OF JOKES FROM SEPT. 17 -- 8
Bill Clinton: 3 % CHANGE FROM SEPT. 17 -- down 82% NUMBER OF JOKES FROM SEPT. 17 -- 17
Ralph Nader: 3 % CHANGE FROM SEPT. 17 -- up 200% NUMBER OF JOKES FROM SEPT. 17 -- 1

''I was watching it. Both Al Gore and George Bush wore the exact same thing. Not similar, the exact same thing. Black suit, white shirt, red tie...They sounded alike, they dressed alike, it's like 'The Patty Duke Show.'''

''It's been reported that George W. Bush is thinking about dumping Dick Cheney as his running mate and replacing him with John McCain. Meanwhile, Dick Cheney is thinking about dumping George W. and replacing him with Martin Sheen.''
Conan O'Brien (Shows monitored:Late Show With David Letterman[CBS] ; Tonight with Jay Leno [NBC]; Late Night With Conan O'Brien [NBC].)
